thread.title_full: Joshua vs Klitschko: Anthony Joshua claims Wladimir Klitschko hates mind games | Boxing News | Sky Sports

author: Nick Lustig
title: Joshua vs Klitschko: Anthony Joshua claims Wladimir Klitschko hates mind games | Boxing News | Sky Sports
text:
Joshua vs Klitschko: Anthony Joshua claims Wladimir Klitschko hates mind games By Nick Lustig Last Updated: 01/02/17 2:31pm Anthony Joshua and Wladimir Klitschko have gone face to face in New York City as the countdown to their Wembley showdown continues Anthony Joshua has claimed heavyweight rival Wladimir Klitschko "doesn't like mind games" ahead of their Wembley showdown. 
Joshua (18-0 KO18) is preparing to defend his IBF heavyweight title against Klitschko (64-4 KO53) in front of 90,000 fans at Wembley Stadium on April 29, live on Sky Sports Box Offic e, with the vacant WBA strap also on the line. 
The pair faced off on Tuesday at Madison Square Garden in New York, with unbeaten Joshua hinting that he may have tried to unsettle the former IBF, WBO and WBA champion. Joshua and Klitschko pose for the cameras during their media conference in New York 
"He (Klitschko) doesn't like mind games," he told Sky Sports News HQ . 
"In three years I'll be too good and in three years he'll be too old. What he says is true - this is the perfect time. 
"My obsession is about life and is about me. What I have got to do to be the best me? The outcome will always naturally happen. Upgrade now to watch all eight Sky Sports channels for only Â£20 for 12 months 
"Don't worry about the title. Worry about what you've got to do today, tomorrow, the next day and that title will be waiting for you. 
"The fight is one under the dark lights and you go under the lights to shine, so I am looking forward to getting back in there." Anthony Joshua v Wladimir Klitschko - Tale of the Tape 
Watch Anthony Joshua vs Wladimir Klitschko from Wembley Stadium, live on Sky Sports Box Office, on Saturday, April 29.
